member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Exceptions.SafeException
member.summary: Use the class as the base exception for your custom exception classes, so you can easily recognize them in code. This can be handy in a few cases. For example, calling the extension method passing as the generic type (or calling the extension method), will only return messages from your custom exceptions which can help you control the error details sent to the other apps and make sure sensitive information is not leaked outside of your application.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Exceptions.SafeException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ExceptionExtensions
member.summary: Implements the most frequently used extension methods, such as getting the error messages for both current and all inner exceptions, for the types.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ExceptionExtensions.GetMessages``1(System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns messages from the immediate and inner exceptions derived from the specified type.
member.typeparam: Base type of the exception that will be included in the error message.
member.remarks: Use the T type to identify derivatives of which exceptions will be included in the complete error message. This can be useful if you only want to filter out system and third-party exceptions out of the error message and only include your own. For example, say you have MyBaseException and a number of exceptions that derive from it. If you specify the MyBaseException type as the generic type T, then only MyBaseException and exceptions derived from it will be included in the error message.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ExceptionExtensions.GetSafeMessages(System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets messages from the immediate and all inner exceptions.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ExceptionExtensions.GetMessages(System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets messages from the immediate and all inner exceptions.

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions
member.summary: Implements the most frequently used extension methods, such as getting the count of items in a collection and converting a collection of generic elements to a comma-separated string value, for the types.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions.Count(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Returns the number of items in any collection type.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions.ToCsv``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a collection of generic elements to a comma-separated string value.
member.typeparam: Data type of the generic elements.
member.param: Right quote enclosing each value (if left quote is specified and right quote is not, then left quote will be used as right quote).
member.returns: Comma-(or whatever)-separated string value (or empty string if collection is null or empty).

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions
member.summary: Implements the most frequently used extension methods, such as deep cloning, checking object equivalency, getting and setting a nested property value by a compound name, and more, for all (any ) types.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.Clone``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of a strongly typed object (does not require type casting).

example.code: MyObject? cloneObject = originalObject.Clone();

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.Clone(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of an object (requires type casting).

example.code: MyObject? cloneObject = (MyObject?)originalObject.Clone();

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.Copy(System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the specified object.
member.param: A dictionary to keep track of visited objects to handle circular references.
member.returns: A deep copy of the original object.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.CopyBaseTypePrivateFields(System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object},System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Recursively copies the fields of the specified object.
member.param: A dictionary to keep track of visited objects to handle circular references.
The clone object to populate with copied fields.
The type of the object to reflect on.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.CopyFields(System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object},System.Object,System.Type,System.Reflection.BindingFlags,System.Func{System.Reflection.FieldInfo,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Copies the fields of the specified object.
member.param: A dictionary to keep track of visited objects to handle circular references.
The clone object to populate with copied fields.
The type of the object to reflect on.
The binding flags to use for reflection.
An optional filter to apply to the fields.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.IsEmpty(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object has no properties or fields holding non-null values or non-empty collections.
member.param: If true, only public properties and fields will be checked.
member.returns: true if the object is empty; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.GetPropertyValue(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the immediate or nested object property.
member.param: Name of the property (case-insensitive; can be compound with names separated by periods).
member.returns: Property value (or null, if property does not exists).

remarks.para: The code assumes that the property exists; if it does not, the code will return null.
The code handles both class properties and fields.

example.code: string? givenName = user.GetPropertyValue("Name.GivenName"); int? age = user.GetPropertyValue("Age");

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.SetPropertyValue(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the new value of an immediate or nested object property (creating parent properties if needed).
member.param: Object that owns the property to be set.
Name of the property (case-insensitive; can be compound with names separated by periods).

example.code: user.SetPropertyValue("Name.GivenName", "Smith"); user.GetPropertyValue("Age", 42);

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.IsEmptyValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified value is empty. A value is considered empty if it is null, an empty string, an empty collection, or an empty enumerable.
member.returns: true if the value is empty; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.NormalizePropertyName(System.String)
member.summary: Converts slashes to periods in the compound property names.
member.returns: Normalized property name with slashes replaced by periods.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.IsEquivalentTo(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the source object is identical to the target (comparing all instance properties and fields).
member.param: If true, the null value of the source indicates that the property is unchanged.
If true, only public properties and fields will be checked.
member.returns: True if objects are equivalent, otherwise, false.

member.summary: Converts a string to a value.

member.summary: Converts a string to a value.

example.code: DateOnly? d1 = "2023-11-01".ToDateOnly(); DateOnly? d2 = "01/11/2023".ToDateOnly("dd/MM/yyyy");

member.summary: Converts a string to a value.

example.code: TimeOnly? t1 = "23:11:01".ToTimeOnly(); TimeOnly? t2 = "11:35:48 PM".ToTimeOnly("hh:mm:ss tt");

member.summary: Converts string to a list.
member.typeparam: Data type of the list elements.

example.code: // Will hold: key1=value1, key2=value2 List<string> result = "value1|value2|value3".ToList<string>();

member.typeparam: Data type of the array elements.

example.code: // Will hold: key1=value1, key2=value2 string[] result = "value1|value2|value3".ToArray<string>();

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.Specialized.StringExtensions.ToDictionary``2(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.StringSplitOptions,System.StringSplitOptions)
member.summary: Converts string to a dictionary.
member.typeparam: Data type of the dictionary key elements.
Data type of the dictionary value elements.
member.param: Options for splitting key from value.

example.code: // Will hold: key1=value1, key2=value2 Dictionary<string,string> result = "key1=value1|key2=value2".ToDictionary<string, string>();

member.summary: Checks if the string contains valid JSON text.
member.returns: True if the string is a valid JSON, otherwise false.

member.summary: Checks if the string contains an HTML document.

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.Specialized.TypeExtensions
member.summary: Implements advanced extension methods for the types.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.Specialized.TypeExtensions.IsSimple(System.Type)
member.summary: Determine whether the specified type is simple (i.e. enum, string, number, GUID, date, time, offset, etc.) or complex (i.e. custom class with public properties and methods, list, array, etc.).
member.returns: True if the type is simple; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
Adapted from https://github.com/Burtsev-Alexey/net-object-deep-copy/blob/master/ObjectExtensions.cs for object cloning, but also see
and .

example.code: Console.WriteLine(typeof(int).IsSimple()); // True Console.WriteLine(typeof(string).IsSimple()); // True Console.WriteLine(typeof(DateTime).IsSimple()); // True Console.WriteLine(typeof(Guid).IsSimple()); // True Console.WriteLine(typeof(Employee).IsSimple()); // False

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.Specialized.TypeExtensions.IsPrimitive(System.Type)
member.summary: Determine whether the specified type is a primitive type.
member.returns: True if the specified type is a primitive type; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.StringExtensions
member.summary: Implements the most frequently used extension methods, such as escaping special characters, making sure the sting ends ina punctuation character, etc., for the types.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.StringExtensions.Escape(System.String,System.Char,System.String)
member.summary: Escapes specific characters in a string.
member.param: Specifies the character that must be escaped.
Specifies the replacement string for the escaped character (may need to include the escaped character).
member.returns: String value with properly escaped character.

example.code: // escaped = in "It''s a test". string escaped = "It's a test".Escape();

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.StringExtensions.ToSentence(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends a period at the end of the string, unless it already ends with one of the punctuation characters: ,.!?;:
member.param: Indicates that white space characters must be trimmed from the string start.
Indicates that white space characters must be trimmed from the string end.
member.returns: Input string that has a valid punctuation string at the end.

example.code: // PRINTS: "Hello, world." Console.WriteLine(" Hello, world ".ToSentence());

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Json.JsonExtensions
member.summary: Implements extension methods for data conversion to and from JSON strings.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Json.JsonExtensions.ToJson(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts an object to a JSON string.
member.param: If true, serialized JSON elements will be indented.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Json.JsonExtensions.FromJson``1(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a JSON string to an object.
member.returns: Converted value or default if conversion failed.
member.remarks: Enumerated properties in the JSON string are assumed to hold the field names, i.e. string, not integer, values.

example.code: User? user = "{\"id\":123,\"name\":\"John\"}".FromJson<User>();

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf
member.summary: Think of the class as the nameof expression on steroids that can generate fully qualified or partial names of variables, types, or members in the original case or camelCase notation.

remarks.para: When applying the methods to types (vs. object properties), use it with the nameof expression.
Special characters (?, !, @) will be removed from the object property names.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Full(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns full name of the object, class, type, or property.
member.param: Indicates whether to return the name in camelCase.
member.returns: Full name including all compound parts.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Long(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the partial name of the object, class, type, or property omitting the entry before the first period (counting from left to right).
member.returns: Name without the first (left) compound prefix.
member.remarks: If the name does not include any compound parts, it will be returned as-is.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Short(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the short name of the immediate object property (same as nameof()).

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Skip(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a shortened name of the object, class, type, or property after removing the specified number of compound prefixes or suffixes.
member.param: Full or partial property name (can also be referenced using nameof).

Number of parts to be excluded from the result. A positive number indicates skipping from the left, a negative number indicates skipping from the right. If the skipped number is bigger than the number of parts, an empty string will be returned.
If true, parameter names will be converted to camelCase.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Keep(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a shortened name of the object, class, type, or property keeping the specified number of compound prefixes or suffixes.
member.param: Full or partial property name (can also be referenced using nameof).

Number of parts to be included in the result. A positive number indicates including from the left, a negative number indicates including from the right. If the kept number is bigger than the number of parts, an empty string will be returned.
If true, parameter names will be converted to camelCase.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.Normalize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes special characters (?, !, @) from a compound object property name.
member.param: Compound property name, such as myObject?.PropertyX!.Value.
If true, the normalized name will be converted to camelCase.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.NameOf.RemoveNameOf(System.String)
member.summary: Removes nameof from the name.
member.param: Name that may the leading nameof prefix.

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly
member.summary: Returns the most frequently used attributes (company, copyright, product, version, title) of the running application's primary assembly.

remarks.para: The primary assembly is probed in the following order:
Adapted from the Access AssemblyInfo File and Get Product Informations article by Ravee Rasaiyah.

member.name: P:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.Company
member.summary:
Returns the company name defined in the
of the primary assembly.

member.name: P:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.Copyright
member.summary:
Returns the copyright message defined in the
of the primary assembly.

member.name: P:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.Description
member.summary:
Returns the assembly description defined in the
of the primary assembly.

member.name: P:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.Product
member.summary:
Returns the product name defined in the
of the primary assembly.

member.name: P:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.Title
member.summary:
Returns the assembly title defined in the
of the primary assembly.

member.name: P:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.Version
member.summary:
Returns the version of the assembly file defined in the
of the primary assembly.
member.remarks: For additional information about assembly and file versions, see .

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.GetAssembly(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the main application assembly or the assembly implementing the specified type.
member.param: Optional type of the class implemented in the assembly.
member.returns: Current assembly or the assembly implementing the specified type.
member.remarks: If type is not specified, assemblies are probed in the following order: 1. `Assembly.GetEntryAssembly()` 2. `Assembly.GetCallingAssembly()` 3. `Assembly.GetExecutingAssembly()`, 4. `Assembly.GetAssembly(typeof(PrimaryAssembly))`

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.PrimaryAssembly.GetCustomAttribute``1
member.summary: Returns the custom assembly attribute.

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.RegularExpressions.RegexString
member.summary: Implements common regular expressions.
member.remarks: This class is not declared as static because a static class cannot be extended. If you extend this class, you can access both these regular expressions and your custom regular expressions from your derived class.

member.name: F:DotNetExtras.Common.RegularExpressions.RegexString.Guid
member.summary: A regular expression for validating GUID/UUID values: ^[({]?[a-fA-F0-9]{8}[-]?([a-fA-F0-9]{4}[-]?){3}[a-fA-F0-9]{12}[})]?$

remarks.para: This regular expression allows GUID/UUID values to be enclosed in parentheses or braces and allows hyphens to be optional (also, can use upper an lower letters a-f).

Adapted from
except that instead of using the \A and \Z modifiers identifying the beginning and end of the string anchors it uses the standard regular expression ^and $ anchors ().
Do not allow asterisk because it may interfere with some Azure queries.
Max length is set to 64 chars due to Azure limitations (how it handles the mailNickname and userPrincipalAttribute).

member.name: T:DotNetExtras.Common.Utilities.ArrayTraverse
member.summary: Implements extension methods for array traversals.

member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Utilities.ReferenceEqualityComparer.GetHashCode(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the hash code for the specified object.
